a segment size of up to 64 terabytes and so in our testing that translates into a
graph of somewhere between 100 billion and 200 billion nodes edges and properties or triples so you can
certainly get to that sort of data scale size and then the underlying architecture is that there's a write
master with up to 15 different low latency you read replicas so in the
event of a failure of the right master if you've provisioned a read replicas you'll basically you'll have a failover
in which case the read replicas will be promoted to the right master and if you
don't have a read replicas that one a new one will be created for you I think that's part of high availability as a
managed service too right is that there's there's always backup options in case something isn't working quite the
